On Thu, Feb 27, 2025 at 7:05?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hello Jeffrey,
In response to your question about why PII content pasted to paste.mozilla.org is not being detected:

To prevent users from copying and pasting sensitive content onto paste.mozilla.org, you need to ensure that clipboard monitoring is enabled. The reason the content isn’t being caught is likely because clipboard monitoring is not currently active. When enabled, the EPP client software monitors all clipboard content on a computer, regardless of the destination.

Please see the Endpoint Protector 5.9.3.0 User Manual on page 78.

Note: This setting only applies to Copy operations.

When a Copy operation is performed, the Endpoint Protector Client inspects the clipboard content, and if it detects confidential information, it deletes it.

Consequently, the Paste operation won’t work because the clipboard content has been removed.

If clipboard monitoring is not enabled, the EPP client software will not monitor, block, or delete the PII content before it is pasted onto paste.mozilla.org.



Please let me know if this clarifies your question or if there are any other questions you have.

Thank you.
Best Regards,

Hello Jeffrey,

To answer your question, If a CAP is set to "block and remediate" is reporting enabled for that policy? The answer is yes on the initial block. A report is generated for the initial block, and yes a report is generated for the remediation of the file that has been set to remediate. The reports will be found in the EPP UI, under Reports and Analysis > Content Aware Report.

Example:



 As far as finding the status of the Justification of the remediated file, this information can be found in System Parameters > User Remediation > Justification List. From here you can see whether or not a file is set to remediate or not. You can also enable or disable the remediation from here by selecting Actions > Edit > Status (enable/disable), then save. 



Please let me know if this answers your question. 

Thank you.

Hello Jeffrey,
In response to your question about why PII content pasted to paste.mozilla.org is not being detected:

To prevent users from copying and pasting sensitive content onto paste.mozilla.org, you need to ensure that clipboard monitoring is enabled. The reason the content isn’t being caught is likely because clipboard monitoring is not currently active. When enabled, the EPP client software monitors all clipboard content on a computer, regardless of the destination.

Please see the Endpoint Protector 5.9.3.0 User Manual on page 78.

Note: This setting only applies to Copy operations.

When a Copy operation is performed, the Endpoint Protector Client inspects the clipboard content, and if it detects confidential information, it deletes it.

Consequently, the Paste operation won’t work because the clipboard content has been removed.

If clipboard monitoring is not enabled, the EPP client software will not monitor, block, or delete the PII content before it is pasted onto paste.mozilla.org.

To prevent users from copying and pasting sensitive content onto paste.mozilla.org, you need to ensure that clipboard monitoring is enabled. When a Copy operation is performed, the Endpoint Protector Client inspects the clipboard content, and if it detects confidential information, it deletes it.

To prevent users from copying and pasting sensitive content onto paste.mozilla.org, you need to ensure that clipboard monitoring is enabled. When enabled, the EPP client software monitors all clipboard content on a computer, regardless of the destination.

Note: This setting only applies to Copy operations.

When a Copy operation is performed, the Endpoint Protector Client inspects the clipboard content, and if it detects confidential information, it deletes it.

Consequently, the Paste operation won’t work because the clipboard content has been removed.

If clipboard monitoring is not enabled, the EPP client software will not monitor, block, or delete the PII content before it is pasted onto paste.mozilla.org.
